intro: Luffa angolensis, commonly known as the African luffa, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces large, hairy leaves and yellow flowers, with the fruit developing into a fibrous sponge-like structure. The fibrous interior of the mature fruit is used as a natural sponge for bathing or scrubbing. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
